title: UK continues to ‘stand steadfastly’ by Ukraine’s side in 2024, PM tells Zelensky

title: Rishi Sunak called ‘evil’ for boasting about new changes to international student visa rules
description: So, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has decided to kick off 2024 by boasting about “delivering” for the British people by effectively splitting up families of international students and people are rightfully livid about it.

title: In Pictures: Another turbulent 12 months in UK politics
description: Rishi Sunak is still standing after his first full year as Prime Minister but things have been far from plain sailing for the Conservative government.

title: Tories insist Rishi Sunak has ‘steep and narrow’ path to victory despite lagging in polls
description: In an end-of-year analysis, Tory peer Lord Barwell, a former Croydon MP who was Theresa May’s chief-of-staff, argued: “The Conservative brand is too damaged for them to win the next election, but right now the alternative is not getting the scrutiny it should be getting because of the continuing Conservative soap opera over Rwanda et al.

title: Rishi Sunak kicks off year claiming double-win on small boats – with backlog of asylum cases cleared & crossings down

title: Rishi Sunak under fire over ‘misleading’ claim to have cleared asylum backlog
description: Rishi Sunak’s claim to have met a pledge to clear the backlog of so-called legacy asylum claims has been branded misleading as thousands are still awaiting a decision. The prime minister credited “relentless action” as the government announced on Monday that it had met a target to clear a backlog of asylum claims.

title: The Standard View: Rishi Sunak is getting ready for his ballot-box battle

title: Around 1.6 million low-paid workers set to bear brunt of Tory stealth taxes

title: Will the Tories meet their 2019 manifesto pledges?
description: As we approach a 2024 general election in the UK, it is Rishi Sunak, not Boris Johnson, who will be held accountable for any broken promises. The government is likely to fail on this manifesto pledge – even after cutting back its target from 40 to 32 ...

title: Petrol prices set to rise amid rebel attacks on Red Sea shipping

title: Lib Dems Aim To Unseat Jeremy Hunt And Michael Gove As Election Campaign Begins
description: The Lib Dems will target the seats of Jeremy Hunt and Michael Gove at the next election as the party aims to tear down the “blue wall” at the general election. Lib Dem leader Ed Davey will campaign across marginal seats in Surrey - where both cabinet ministers have their seats - on Wednesday.

title: Sunak draws up income tax cut plan
description: The Government is weighing up pre-election cuts to income tax as Rishi Sunak seeks to draw dividing lines with Labour on the economy. The Prime Minister will use his first public appearance of the year on Thursday to argue that he is cutting taxes on individuals – despite the overall tax burden heading for a record high.

title: ANDREW NEIL: With Putin, Xi Jinping and Kim Jong Un issuing New Year threats, the West's woeful leadership crisis means 2024 could become the year of the despots
description: Even though there will be votes in over 60 countries, 2024 is more likely to be a year of crisis for democracy, which is in greater peril than at any time since the Cold War.

title: Revealed: The NHS fat cats pocketing up to £300,000 a year while running floundering trusts as the longest doctors' strike in history begins
description: While the row over pay and conditions shows little sign of a conclusion, a Mail investigation found bosses of the 11 trusts with the longest referral waiting times all earn more than the Prime Minister.

title: Wood panels in living rooms. City life back in vogue... nine trends for 2024 house prices
description: Bold interior trends, falling borrowing costs and new opportunities for first-time buyers will bring colour and life back into the property market in 2024.

title: Channel migrant crossings could hit 35,000 this year despite ‘stop the boats’ pledge
description: Channel migrant crossings are projected to rise to around 35,000 this year despite Rishi Sunak’s pledge to “stop the boats” by the next election, according to leaked Border Force documents.

description: The quakes, the largest of which had a magnitude of 7.6, started a fire and collapsed buildings on the west coast of Japan’s main island, Honshu
